TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientCertificateCredential extends Azure.Core.TokenCredential

Docs.summary: Enables authentication of a service principal to Microsoft Entra ID using a X509 certificate that is assigned to its App Registration. More information on how to configure certificate authentication can be found at .

MemberSignature.Value: public override Azure.Core.AccessToken GetToken (Azure.Core.TokenRequestContext requestContext, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype Azure.Core.AccessToken GetToken(valuetype Azure.Core.TokenRequestContext requestContext, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetToken (requestContext As TokenRequestContext, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As AccessToken
override this.GetToken : Azure.Core.TokenRequestContext * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Core.AccessToken

Docs.param: The details of the authentication request.
A controlling the request lifetime.
Docs.summary: Obtains a token from Microsoft Entra ID, using the specified X509 certificate to authenticate. Acquired tokens are cached by the credential instance. Token lifetime and refreshing is handled automatically. Where possible, reuse credential instances to optimize cache effectiveness.
Docs.returns: An which can be used to authenticate service client calls.
